sub_title: Senior Project Manager at TNO Transport & Mobility
summary:
Tariq van Rooijen (1980) is employed at TNO Transport and Mobility as a senior project manager. Since 2006 he has been working on mobility projects for governments and companies in the Netherlands and Europe. Tariq focuses mainly on projects in the field of urban mobility and rail transport.

Between 2009 and 2013 he was project coordinator of the European CIVITAS POINTER consortium. This project contains the monitoring and evaluation of all sustainable transport measures in cities which are part of the EU CIVITAS initiative (city-vitality-sustainable). Recently, Tariq also became project coordinator of the successor of POINTER, named CIVITAS WIKI.

At present Tariqâ€™s portfolio also includes the TNO project management of the EU H2020 FR-EVUE project. The aim of this project is to assist the uptake of electric mobility for freight vehicles in urban Europe with pilots in 8 cities. Next to that, he is project manager of TNO's smart city and TOD-projects in Shenzhen (China).

In 2011 he took over the role as project coordinator of the RETRACK project, that finished early 2013. TNO led this R&D/demonstration project in which a large group of rail operators and knowledge partners worked together to establish a rail freight corridor between Rotterdam and Hungary. A shuttle service is up and running 3 to 4 times a week.

Tariq holds master degrees in Operations research & Logistics (Wageningen University) and Infrastructure planning (Groningen University).
